comments: Let W(i,j) denote the index of that row of the extended Wythoff array (see A035513) that contains the sequence formed by the sum of rows i and j. Then a(n) = W(2,n). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 07 2016
references: J. H. Conway, Posting to Math Fun Mailing List, Dec 02 1996.
M. LeBrun, Posting to Math Fun Mailing List Jan 10 1997.
links: J. H. Conway, Allan Wechsler, Marc LeBrun, Dan Hoey, N. J. A. Sloane, On Kimberling Sums and Para-Fibonacci Sequences, Correspondence and Postings to Math-Fun Mailing List, Nov 1996 to Jan 1997
formula: a(n) = 1 if n=0, otherwise a(n) = A000201(n)+n+3. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 07 2016
crossrefs: The "Kim-sums" K_n + K_i for i = 2 through 12 are given in A022413, A022414, A022415, A022416, ..., A022423.
author: _Marc LeBrun_
